definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: The young girl violinist outshone all the other competitors.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴使所有的競爭者相形見絀。
本使他的同事們都相形見絀。

sentences.english: She dwarfed all her rivals in athletic ability.
sentences.chinese: 她在體育運動方面的才能使她的對手相形見絀。

sentences.english: U8 :It goes without saying that Shakespeare overshadows all the other playwrights through the ages.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，莎士比亞使各個時代的劇作家相形見絀。

sentences.english: We are overshadowed by a nimbus of ideas.
sentences.chinese: 想法周圍的光環讓我們相形見絀。

sentences.english: What overshadows everything else is the castle.
sentences.chinese: 城堡使其他一切都相形見絀。

sentences.english: She seems extinguished by her younger sister in computery.
sentences.chinese: 在計算機的操作方面她妹妹似乎使她相形見絀。

sentences.english: Your beautiful garden put my few little flowers to shame.
sentences.chinese: 你那漂亮的花園使我那幾朵小花相形見絀。

sentences.english: The fast maturing of girls leads to them outshining boys in exams.
sentences.chinese: 女孩的迅速成熟導致男孩在考試中相形見絀。

sentences.english: The publication of this new handbook have throw the old one into the shade.
sentences.chinese: 這本新手冊的出版使舊作相形見絀。

sentences.english: He had him replaced with a powerful ally, Mark Malloch Brown, whose overpowering presence often seemed to diminish Annan.
sentences.chinese: 布朗的強勢作爲常使安南相形見絀。

sentences.english: Just the Ming Dynasty Wall dwarfs10 the Three Gorges dam project, " Lindesay says."
sentences.chinese: 光是明代長城就使三峽大壩工程相形見絀。

sentences.english: She outshines all of other competitors.
sentences.chinese: 她使所有的競爭者都相形見絀。

sentences.english: But this only makes matters worse for the country's pouting men.
sentences.chinese: 兩相對照，那些撅嘴板臉的男隊員更是相形見絀。

sentences.english: A giant's laughter could put to shame a dragon's roar.
sentences.chinese: 巨人的大笑聲能讓龍的咆哮都相形見絀。

sentences.english: It goes without saying that Shakespeare overshadows all the other playwrights throughout the ages.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，莎士比亞使各個時代的劇作家相形見絀。

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to look favorably on sth/would be glad to see it happen
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
